profile.name: Jeel Chandegra
profile.title: Flutter & React Developer
profile.bio: Passionate about creating beautiful, high-performance mobile apps using Flutter, built with modern design principles, clean architecture, and a focus on smooth, delightful user experiences. I specialize in building scalable, high-performance mobile applications using Flutter and React. My focus is on clean architecture, modern design patterns, and crafting smooth, intuitive user experiences. Passionate about writing clean, maintainable code and staying up to date with the latest tools and frameworks to deliver reliable, production-ready apps that users love.
profile.professionalSummary: I specialize in building scalable, high-performance mobile applications using Flutter, React, Firebase, and AI technologies. My focus is on clean architecture, modern design patterns, and crafting smooth, intuitive user experiences.

projects.title: Codeforces Problem Tracker
projects.shortDescription: Analytics dashboard for tracking competitive programming progress on Codeforces with smart problem recommendations.
projects.fullDescription: A comprehensive web-based analytics dashboard for tracking and improving competitive programming progress on Codeforces. Features personalized problem recommendations, streak tracking, visual analytics, and progress monitoring - all in a single-page application with zero server requirements.
projects.keyInnovation: Smart recommendation engine with 6 personalized problem categories based on user skill level and solving patterns
features: User Statistics Dashboard - Total solved, average rating, max rating, current & longest streaks
Visual Analytics - Rating distribution bar chart and topic mastery doughnut charts using Chart.js
Smart Problem Recommendations - 6 categories: Weak Topics, Next Level, Popular Unsolved, Mixed Practice, Similar to Recent, Contest Prep
Topic Mastery Progress - Visual progress bars with Beginner/Intermediate/Master levels for each topic
Problem Randomizer - Filter by difficulty and tag, random unsolved problem generator
Advanced Filtering - By difficulty (800-1600+) and topic/tag with real-time updates
Pagination System - 10 problems per page with Previous/Next navigation
Dark/Light Theme Toggle - Complete dark mode with localStorage preference saving

technicalStack.storage: LocalStorage for theme, in-memory caching for problems/submissions
technicalStack.styling: CSS variables for theming, responsive grid system

keyAlgorithms.streakCalculation: Tracks consecutive days from submission timestamps, calculates current and longest streaks
keyAlgorithms.nextLevelRating: Blends average rating with 75th percentile: (avg + percentile) / 2 + 50 for balanced progression
keyAlgorithms.weakTopicsDetection: Compares solve rates across tags with â‰¥5 problems, recommends from lowest 3 rates
keyAlgorithms.topicMastery: Progress = (solved / total) Ã— 100%, Levels: <50% Beginner, 50-80% Intermediate, 80%+ Master
keyAlgorithms.similarProblems: Analyzes last 5 solved problems, finds matches with 2+ shared tags at similar difficulty

challengesSolved.problem: Generic problem lists don't adapt to individual skill levels and learning patterns
challengesSolved.solution: Built 6-category recommendation system analyzing solve history, weak topics, rating progression, and tag preferences for tailored practice suggestions
Implemented dual streak system (current & longest) with day-by-day analysis from submission timestamps, displayed prominently with ðŸ”¥ visual indicator

challengesSolved.problem: Hard to identify strengths and weaknesses across 35+ competitive programming topics
challengesSolved.solution: Created topic mastery system with color-coded progress bars, solve rate percentages, and skill level badges (Beginner/Intermediate/Master)

challengesSolved.problem: Needed comprehensive analytics without server infrastructure
challengesSolved.solution: Leveraged Codeforces public API with client-side data processing, localStorage caching, and Chart.js visualizations - pure frontend solution

userExperience.responsive: Mobile-friendly grid system with adaptive components
userExperience.colorCoded: Green backgrounds for solved problems, gold/blue/gray mastery badges
userExperience.interactive: Clickable problem cards open directly in Codeforces, smooth animations
userExperience.errorHandling: Loading spinners for API calls, user-friendly error messages

benefits: Identify weaknesses through solve rate analysis across all topics
Track progress with visual mastery levels and streak monitoring
Stay motivated with gamified streak tracking and achievement goals
Practice efficiently with 6 types of personalized recommendations
Prepare for contests with simulated problem sets (5 problems: warm-up to very hard)
Discover trending problems through popularity rankings
No backend required - pure frontend using public Codeforces API

projects.title: Gemini AI Chatbot
projects.shortDescription: Feature-rich interactive chatbot powered by Google Gemini AI with advanced markdown rendering and conversation management.
projects.fullDescription: A feature-rich, interactive chatbot web application powered by Google's Gemini AI API, built with React. The application provides an intelligent conversational interface with advanced response formatting and conversation management capabilities.
projects.keyInnovation: Multi-model AI support with intelligent API key rotation and persistent conversation context
features: Multi-Model Support - Toggle between Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini 1.5 Flash models
Advanced Markdown Rendering - Rich text formatting with syntax highlighting using react-syntax-highlighter
Persistent Chat History - Conversation storage using localStorage with context-aware responses
Multi-API Key Management - Three rotating API keys with usage tracking and automatic rate limit detection
Concise Mode - Toggle for brief or detailed responses based on user preference
Copy Functionality - Easy-to-use copy buttons for code blocks, blockquotes, and full responses
Smart Context Retention - Maintains last 20 messages for contextual conversations

technicalStack.markdownRendering: react-markdown with react-syntax-highlighter (VS Code Dark Plus theme)

keyTechnicalAchievements: Real-time API rate limit monitoring and error handling
Dynamic model configuration with temperature and token controls
Responsive chat interface with distinct user/bot message styling
Keyboard shortcuts (Enter to send) for improved UX

challengesSolved.problem: Single API key would hit rate limits during heavy usage
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented intelligent API key rotation system with three keys, automatic usage tracking, and fallback mechanisms to ensure uninterrupted service

challengesSolved.problem: Maintaining meaningful conversation flow across multiple exchanges
challengesSolved.solution: Built context retention system that preserves last 20 messages, automatically manages token limits, and provides relevant context to AI for coherent responses

challengesSolved.problem: AI responses with code blocks needed proper syntax highlighting
challengesSolved.solution: Integrated react-syntax-highlighter with VS Code Dark Plus theme, added one-click copy functionality for code snippets and responses

projects.title: Adaptive Quiz Engine with AI-Powered Learning
projects.shortDescription: AI-powered learning platform using IRT algorithms and Google Gemini for personalized quizzes.
projects.fullDescription: An intelligent, personalized learning platform that adapts to student ability in real-time using psychometric algorithms and generative AI. Unlike traditional quiz apps that present static questions, this platform uses Item Response Theory (IRT) â€” the same psychometric framework used in standardized tests like GRE, GMAT, and SAT â€” combined with Google Gemini 2.5 AI to generate contextually relevant questions at precisely calibrated difficulty levels.
projects.keyInnovation: Combines Item Response Theory with Google Gemini 2.5 AI for real-time adaptive difficulty adjustment
features: Adaptive Difficulty Engine using 3-Parameter Logistic IRT Model with Bayesian updating
AI-Powered Question Generation with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash API
Document-Based Learning with PDF upload and RAG pipeline
Advanced Analytics Dashboard with real-time performance tracking
Firebase Cloud Integration with offline-first architecture

algorithms.irt3PL: Item Response Theory 3-Parameter Logistic Model for ability estimation
algorithms.bayesian: Bayesian theta estimation with Maximum A Posteriori optimization
algorithms.rag: Retrieval-Augmented Generation pipeline with smart chunking and keyword-based retrieval

challengesSolved.problem: How to adjust difficulty dynamically without frustrating users or making quizzes too easy
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented Bayesian IRT with informative priors to prevent wild ability swings. Added learning rate (0.7) and max theta change constraints (Â±1.5). Used exponential smoothing for gradual difficulty transitions.

challengesSolved.problem: Gemini API calls took 5-30 seconds, creating poor UX
challengesSolved.solution: Question pooling - pre-generate 5 questions, serve instantly from pool. Background refill while user answers. Smart caching. Timeout optimization. Result: Average latency reduced from 15s â†’ <2s

challengesSolved.problem: AI might generate repetitive questions, frustrating users
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented fuzzy string matching with Levenshtein distance. Track previous questions and send to Gemini as negative examples. 70% similarity threshold triggers rejection.

challengesSolved.problem: Large PDFs exceed Gemini's 8K token context limit
challengesSolved.solution: Intelligent chunking (500 tokens/chunk with 50-token overlap). RAG pipeline retrieves only top-5 most relevant chunks. TF-IDF scoring for semantic relevance. Chapter filtering for specific document sections.

achievements: Implemented production-grade IRT algorithm from academic papers
Reduced AI response latency by 90% through intelligent pooling and caching
Built complete RAG pipeline with PDF processing, chunking, and retrieval
Designed scalable architecture supporting 1,000+ concurrent users
Delivered full-stack solution from UI to cloud infrastructure

projects.title: ProBuddy - Professional Networking App
projects.shortDescription: Swipe-based professional networking app for developers with real-time messaging.
projects.fullDescription: ProBuddy is a mobile application that revolutionizes professional networking for software developers and tech professionals. Built with Flutter and Firebase, it combines the engaging swipe mechanics of modern dating apps with professional networking features, making it easy and fun to find collaborators, discover projects, and build meaningful professional connections.
projects.problemStatement: Traditional professional networking platforms often feel formal and time-consuming. Developers need a more engaging, intuitive way to discover project collaboration opportunities, connect with like-minded professionals, showcase their skills and projects, and find teammates for hackathons and side projects.
features: Swipe-Based Discovery Interface - Tinder-like card swiper for browsing project opportunities
Dynamic User Profiles with customizable professional profiles, project portfolio integration, and real-time avatar generation using DiceBear API
Intelligent Search & Filtering with multi-criteria filtering (Skills, Location, Experience) and tag-based categorization
Connection Management System - send and receive connection requests, accept/reject functionality
Real-Time Messaging - in-app chat functionality between connections with message persistence
Project Posting & Applications - create and publish project opportunities, track user applications

technicalImplementation.frontend: Flutter 3.7+ with Dart, Material Design 3 with custom dark theme
technicalImplementation.backend: Firebase Authentication, Cloud Firestore, Firebase Storage
technicalImplementation.navigation: Custom bottom navigation with IndexedStack for state preservation

keyTechnicalAchievements: State Persistence Architecture - Implemented AutomaticKeepAliveClientMixin to preserve widget state, cards maintain position when users switch between tabs
Optimized Data Loading - Pagination with batch loading (10 posts at a time), reduced read operations by 60% through smart caching
Avatar System - Integrated DiceBear API with SVG rendering and client-side caching
Advanced Filtering System - Multi-dimensional filtering with Firestore array-contains queries
Real-time Chat Implementation - Bidirectional message flow with Firestore streams

challengesSolved.problem: Card swiper reset to beginning when users switched tabs
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented AutomaticKeepAliveClientMixin with IndexedStack and PageStorage to maintain widget state across navigation

challengesSolved.problem: Complex filtering caused slow queries and high read costs
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented compound indexes, batch loading, and smart caching strategies to reduce read operations by 60%

challengesSolved.problem: Loading avatars from API on every render caused lag
challengesSolved.solution: Created caching layer with SVG string storage in Firestore and memory cache for frequently accessed avatars

metrics.performance: App launch to first interaction < 2 seconds

projects.title: Scribble Game - Real-Time Multiplayer
projects.shortDescription: Real-time multiplayer drawing and guessing game with live synchronization.
projects.fullDescription: Scribble Game is a real-time multiplayer drawing and guessing game built with Flutter and Firebase. Players can create or join game rooms, take turns drawing words while others guess, and compete in an engaging social gaming experience.
features: Real-Time Multiplayer - create or join game rooms with unique room codes
Turn-Based Drawing - players take turns being the drawer who illustrates a word
Word Guessing - other players compete to guess the word by typing in chat
Multiple Drawing Tools - Pencil, Straight line, Rectangle shapes, Circle shapes
Customizable Drawing - 20+ color palette options, 6 different brush sizes (2px - 20px)
Timed Rounds - 80-second countdown timer for each drawing session
Live Chat System - real-time messaging for guesses and communication
Score Tracking - automatic scoring system for correct guesses
projects.realTimeSync: Pan gesture detection for drawing input. Paint content creation with custom properties. Firebase Firestore for action broadcasting. Automatic drawing replication across all clients.
gameFlow: Room Creation/Joining - Generate unique room IDs, Firebase room document creation, Player registration in room
Word Selection - Random word options presented to drawer, Word stored securely (hidden from guessers)
Drawing Phase - Real-time canvas updates, Drawing actions synchronized via Firebase, Chat-based guessing system
Round Completion - Reveal word to all players, Calculate scores for correct guesses, Transition to next round
challengesSolved: Real-Time Synchronization - Implemented efficient Firestore listeners to sync drawing actions with minimal latency across multiple devices
Drawing Performance - Optimized drawing rendering to handle smooth gesture input while broadcasting to Firebase
State Management - Managed complex game states (waiting, selecting, drawing, round end) with proper transitions
Cross-Platform Compatibility - Ensured consistent drawing experience across Android, iOS, and web platforms

projects.title: Employee Attendance Management System
projects.shortDescription: Employee attendance tracking with automated salary calculations and reporting.
projects.fullDescription: A comprehensive Flutter-based mobile application designed to streamline employee attendance tracking and salary management. This full-stack solution provides businesses with an intuitive interface for managing workforce attendance, calculating salaries based on work hours, and handling financial transactions.
features: Interactive Calendar-Based Attendance Tracking with visual calendar interface using table_calendar package
Multiple attendance statuses: Present, Absent, Half Day, Leave, Partial Day
Flexible Working Hours Configuration - customizable standard and half-day hours
Automated Salary Calculations based on total hours worked, employee hourly rate, overtime tracking
Withdrawal/Advance Salary Management with automatic deduction from total earned salary
Comprehensive Employee Management with profiles, positions, and hourly rates

technicalArchitecture.frontend: Flutter (Cross-platform: iOS, Android, Web, Desktop), Material Design 3
technicalArchitecture.database: SQLite via sqflite package, sqflite_common_ffi_web for browser compatibility

challengesSolved.problem: Users couldn't change attendance from Present to Absent for current or previously marked days
rootCauses: In-memory caching conflicts with database state
Provider layer not reflecting immediate database changes
Inconsistent handling of hours/extraHours during status transitions
challengesSolved.solution: Created EnhancedAttendanceScreen with direct database access. Implemented atomic database transactions using rawUpdate for guaranteed updates. Added manual database refresh after each status change. Force hours and extraHours to 0.0 for Absent/Leave statuses at SQL level. Implemented local caching with explicit cache invalidation.

challengesSolved.problem: SQLite doesn't work directly on web browsers
challengesSolved.solution: Implemented sqflite_common_ffi_web for web platform. Conditional initialization based on platform detection. Maintained single codebase for all platforms.

forEmployers: Accurate attendance tracking reduces payroll errors
Transparent salary calculations build employee trust
Advance payment tracking for better cash flow management
forEmployees: Clear visibility into hours worked and earnings

projects.deployment: Android (Native APK), iOS (Native app), Web (PWA ready), Desktop (Windows/Linux/macOS support)

projects.title: Journey Journal - Map-Based Travel Diary
projects.shortDescription: Interactive map-based travel diary with multimedia photo and video support.
projects.fullDescription: Journey Journal is a Flutter-based mobile application that allows users to document their travels by marking locations on an interactive map and attaching media (photos and videos) to each location. The app provides a seamless way to create a visual diary of your journeys with geolocation support and persistent local storage.
features: Interactive Mapping - Dark-themed map using OpenStreetMap with CartoCD dark tiles, Long-press to add markers, Interactive popups
Media Management - Multi-media support for images and videos, Bulk upload, Image gallery grid view, Full-screen viewer with zoom, Built-in video player
Data Persistence - Hive database for local storage without code generation, CRUD operations, Custom adapters, Offline-first architecture
Permissions Handling - Storage permissions, Photo library access, Runtime permission requests

coreFunctionality.addingMarkers: Long-press anywhere on map â†’ Select images/videos â†’ Marker automatically created â†’ Address reverse-geocoded and saved
coreFunctionality.viewingMarkerDetails: Tap marker to see popup â†’ Click View to open full details â†’ Swipe-up sheet shows location address, media grid, add/delete options
coreFunctionality.managingMedia: Add via + button, View in full-screen with pinch-zoom, Delete via X on thumbnails, Play videos in dedicated player

implementationHighlights.customHiveAdapters: Implemented manual TypeAdapters to avoid build_runner code generation issues using JSON serialization
dataModels: MarkerData (coordinates, media list, address, unique ID)
implementationHighlights.userExperience: Loading indicators during media selection, Confirmation snackbars, Draggable scrollable sheet for marker details, Smooth animations

challengesSolved: Build Runner Issues - Implemented custom Hive adapters without code generation
Media Type Detection - Automatic video/image classification based on file extension
State Synchronization - Keeping UI in sync with database changes
Permission Flow - Graceful handling of denied permissions
Memory Management - Efficient handling of multiple media files

achievements: Collected, cleaned, and preprocessed large datasets using Pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn.
Built and trained machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification).

faqs.question: What technologies do you specialize in?
faqs.answer: I specialize in Android development with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, Flutter for cross-platform apps, and modern web technologies like React and TypeScript. I'm proficient in MVVM architecture, Clean Architecture, and Firebase ecosystem.

faqs.question: What's your most complex project?
faqs.answer: The Adaptive Quiz Engine is my most complex project. It combines Item Response Theory (IRT) algorithms with Google Gemini AI for personalized learning, includes a RAG pipeline for document-based learning, and features real-time adaptive difficulty adjustment based on student performance.

faqs.question: How many years of experience do you have?
faqs.answer: I have 5+ years of professional Android development experience, working with companies ranging from startups to established tech firms, delivering 30+ projects across various domains.

faqs.question: What's your development approach?
faqs.answer: I follow clean architecture principles with MVVM pattern, emphasize test-driven development, prioritize user experience, and maintain code quality through code reviews and CI/CD pipelines. I'm committed to writing maintainable, scalable code.

faqs.question: Are you available for new projects?
faqs.answer: Yes! I'm currently available for opportunities. You can reach me at chandegrajeel@gmail.com or connect via GitHub at github.com/jeelchandegra

faqs.question: What makes you different from other developers?
faqs.answer: I combine strong technical skills with problem-solving abilities, having tackled complex challenges like IRT algorithm implementation, real-time multiplayer synchronization, and AI integration. I'm also a fast learner who stays updated with the latest technologies and best practices.
